title: Decay constant - time for X Y Z to reach 135 atoms

content.question: IsotopeDecay Constant <math alttext="open parenthesis, inverse seconds, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>(</mo><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mstyle></math>Initial number of atoms in sample<math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math><math alttext="0.010" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.010</mn></math><math alttext="1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn></math><math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math><math alttext="0.020" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn></math><math alttext="1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn></math><math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math><math alttext="0.020" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn></math><math alttext="2700" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2700</mn></math>The table lists three different isotopes <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>. Also shown is the decay constant and the initial number of atoms in a prepared sample for each isotope, where each sample is prepared at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly ranks the times <math alttext="t sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math> at which each sample is expected to have approximately <math alttext="1000 e raised to the negative 2 power, which is approximately equal to 135" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>≈</mo><mn>135</mn></math> atoms of the original isotope remaining?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, t sub X equals t sub Y, close parenthesis, which is less than t sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub X is less than, t sub Y, which is less than t sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, t sub Y equals t sub Z, close parenthesis, which is less than t sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub Y is less than, t sub Z, which is less than t sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t sub Y is less than, t sub Z, which is less than t sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
